content.description: For this route, the hike in is the crux.
content.location: There are a series of ledges in the middle of the boulder, use them to get about straight up to the top. Its more about controlling your body and moving slow here, use this one to warm-up or just to enjoy climbing on the side of the unbelievably steep mountain you walked up.

content.description: The crux is near the top when you're about to top out. Be careful, hiking out of this one with a hurt ankle is going to be a chore.
content.protection: One pad is the minimum amount of protection
content.location: Sit start on the right side of the boulder, about 6 feet from the end of the boulder and about 2 feet off the ground there is a nice horn to hold onto, then a pinch with the right hand. Straight up from there, everything is in just get to the top, there's a lot of ways to do this route.

content.description: The crux is the move after you have reached the crack. Do your best to hold yourself with a knee bar and find the crimp above with your right hand, it's small and you'll really have to wrench on it.
content.location: Find the flattest spot near the boulder, it's where the boulder makes a turn and creates a corner. Start crouched and use any of the footholds you want. There is a crimp for your right hand and a crimp for the left hand. Move to the crack and top out directly above.
